name: TIC: Tricolour Illumination Conduits
description:
This is a very short puzzle game showing a new mechanic I developed based around covering a board with light cast out from a limited set of directional beams. It starts off very easy but some of the later levels can become kind of tricky.

TIC is the first game I've ever completed and for that reason alone I am already incredibly proud. Feedback is very appreciated however I already feel like I've spent too much time on this project so don't hold your breath for updates.

I'm not confident that all of the puzzle potential has been achieved from this idea but at this point, I don't have the puzzle creation skills to make anything more complex.

There is a level editor though! If you take a stab at making any levels please copy your level codes and share them here in the comments. I would absolutely love to see what you can come up with!

Thank you for taking a look at my game, for even that simple act I'm already grateful. If you would like to see any of my future games, check a look at my twitter @bendolyne!

P.S. When downloading the game to get it for free, please click the obnoxiously greyed out "No thanks, just take me to the downloads" button above the price box.
